title: Teresa Giudice asks friend visiting Jerusalem 'to pray for her dad' that's sick
text:
Teresa Giudice is asking for prayers for her ill father Giacinto Gorga.

The 47-year-old Real Housewife Of New Jersey made the request to her friend Elvira Grau, who owns the Manhattan event venue SPACE24.

'She knew I was going to Israel the next day with my Kabbalah family, so she wrote a note for me to take to Jerusalem to pray for her family,' Elvira confided in Page Six.

Reaching out: Teresa Giudice (left) is asking for prayers for her ill father Giacinto Gorga from her pal Elvira Grau (right); pictured Sunday with their pal Daniella Todd (center)

'To pray for her dad that’s sick, her four beautiful daughters, and for guidance and direction,' said the event venue owner.

Teresa and Elvira had the conversation in the wee hours of Monday morning at SPACE24 during a birthday party for jeweler-to-the-stars Alex Todd.

Giacinto has been the cause of friction between Teresa and her brother Joe Gorga, who is married to Real Housewife Of New Jersey Melissa Gorga.

On the smash hit Bravo reality series, Teresa has been seen upbraiding her brother for, she feels, not paying enough attention to their father.

Throwback: Teresa is pictured with Giacinto in 2013 at the Majestic Resort in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic

During an Easter gathering that was shown on the program last year, Giacinto himself bellowed at Joe and Melissa: 'You never call me no more! F*** you!'

Teresa's plea for divine 'guidance and direction' comes as her husband Joe Giudice awaits a final decision on whether he will be deported to his native Italy.

Last week, he obtained permission to leave ICE custody and relocate to his native Italy before the deportation decision is made.

Joe got the green light from a pair of judges on Thursday to head to Italy as per his earlier petition, according to Us Weekly.

Longtime couple: Teresa's plea for divine 'guidance and direction' comes as her husband Joe Giudice awaits a final decision on whether he will be deported to his native Italy

James J. Leonard Jr., the Giudices' lawyer, argued last month that this move would allow him to begin earning a living for his family again, per People.

Joe was born in Saronno, Lombardy and has been in America since childhood but neglected to ever obtain U.S. citizenship, leaving him vulnerable to deportation after he and Teresa were convicted of various counts of fraud in 2014.

Both Joe and Teresa spent time in jail, serving back-to-back sentences so that one parent at a time could be home with the children.

Troubled times: Both Joe and Teresa spent time in jail, serving back-to-back sentences so that one parent at a time could be home with the children; pictured heading to a sentencing in 2014

The reality TV star couple have been married since 1999 and have four daughters - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10.

After his 36-month prison stint, Joe was transferred straight to the Clinton County Correctional Center in Pennsylvania and into the hands of ICE this March.

Joe's deportation was court ordered last October and his multiple appeal requests have so far fallen on deaf ears.
description: Teresa Giudice is asking for prayers for her ill father Giacinto Gorga.
